subject: Law
title: Mistake: Mutual and Unilateral
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Mistake: Mutual and Unilateral.

hook.text: Both buyer and seller thought the painting was a copy. It was an original worth millions. Who keeps it?

buildup.text: A mutual mistake about a basic assumption of the contract can make it voidable by the harmed party.

discovery.text: Sherwood v. Walker: both parties thought a cow was barren. She was pregnant. The court voided the sale.

twist.text: A unilateral mistakeâ€”only one party is wrongâ€”usually isn't enough to void the contract unless the other party knew.

climax.text: The mistake must go to the essence of the deal, not just a bad judgment about value or market conditions.

punchline.text: When both sides are wrong about what they're trading, the deal can unravel.

quiz.question: When can a mutual mistake void a contract?
options: When both parties share a mistake about a basic assumption
